results.title: Orpheus
results.brief_description: A compelling cinematic allegory of the haunting legend of Eurydice and Orpheus set in modern times, with poet Marais encountering The Princess of Death. Orpheus was allowed to reclaim his dead lover on the condition he did not look back upon her face. But he does … An unforgettable experience of true love, with beautiful music and poetic cinematic effects. Rated: M
results.description: A compelling cinematic allegory of the haunting legend of Eurydice and Orpheus set in modern times, with poet Marais encountering The Princess of Death. results.title: Orphee et Eurydice
results.creator_credit: Opera Australia, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Stefanos Lazaridis and Peter Butler
results.brief_description: Orphee et Eurydice, directed by Stefanos Lazaridis, music by Christoph Willibald Gluck, libretto by Ranierie da Calzabigi, and adapted for the French performing edition by Pierre-Louis Moline, tells the tale of lovers separated by death. Orphee must go on a quest to Hades to find his dead wife Eurydice and bring her back to the living. The voyage is full of peril, and it is only after much heartache that he is reunited with his own true love. Features singers David Hobson (Orphee), Miriam Gormley (L’Amour), Amanda Thane (Eurydice), and The Australian Opera Chorus. Also features the Dancers of the Meryl Tankard Australian Dance Theatre and Dancers of The Australian Opera choreographed by Meryl Tankard, and The Australian Opera and Ballet Orchestra conducted by Marco Guidarini. Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House on 20 September 1993 and produced for television in association with the Australian Broadcasting Corporation. Sung in French with English subtitles.

results.title: Orphee = Orpheus
results.brief_description:
Cocteau’s updating of the Orpheus legend which haunted his own life takes the poet, from contemporary Paris to a mysterious chateau ruled by an imperious Princess, who first claims a younger poet, then Orpheus’ wife, Eurydice. With its unforgettable imagery of leather-clad motorcyclists, the eerie ruins of the Zone and messages from another world received by car radio, this has had a profound influence on both Hollywood and the avant-garde. Awards: Venice Film Festival 1950: Fipresci Prize ; British Academy Awards 1950: Best Film. See also: ‘Le Sang d’Un Poete’ (Blood of a Poet, 1930)[0107789, 16mm] and ‘Le Testament d’Orphee’ (1960) [X000058, 16mm] & ‘The Orpheus Trilogy’ (VHS) [2083267].

Credits: Producer, Andre Paulve ; director, writer, Andre Paulve ; photography, Nicolas Hayer ; music, Georges Auric.
Cast: Jean Marais, Francois Perier, Maria Casares, Marie Dea.

results.title: Orphee
results.creator_credit: Andre Paulve, Les Films du Palais Royal and Jean Cocteau
results.brief_description: Cocteau’s updating of the Orpheus legend which haunted his own life takes the poet (Jean Marais), from contemporary Paris to a mysterious chateau ruled by an imperious Princess (Maria Casares), who first claims a younger poet, then Orpheus’ wife, Eurydice. With its unforgettable imagery of leather-clad motorcyclists, the eerie ruins of the Zone and messages from another world received by car radio, this has had a profound influence on both Hollywood and the avant-garde. Cast also includes Francois Perier, Juliette Greco. In French with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andre Paulve, Les Films du Palais Royal and Jean Cocteau

With its unforgettable imagery of leather-clad motorcyclists, the eerie ruins of the Zone and messages from another world received by car radio, this has had a profound influence on both Hollywood and the avant-garde. Cast also includes Francois Perier, Juliette Greco. In French with English subtitles.

With its unforgettable imagery of leather-clad motorcyclists, the eerie ruins of the Zone and messages from another world received by car radio, this has had a profound influence on both Hollywood and the avant-garde. Cast also includes Francois Perier, Juliette Greco. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Original sin
results.creator_credit: Tom Shandel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
A troubadour sings his song while the camera pans in on individuals in the audience. The song is called Original Sin.

results.title: Origin of the motion picture
results.brief_description: An historical record of the development of the machinery and arts of the motion picture, from the earliest suggestions of Leonardo da Vinci to the perfected sound motion picture of Edison. Scenes as early as 1880 are included and reference is made to the work of Plateau, Daguerre, Muybridge, Marey, Edison, Armat, Dickson and others.

results.title: Origin of life on earth
